channel.title: Great way how to bypass an admin account / change pass!
channel.description:
Hi i will be teaching u how to bypass and admin account/rights!
Ok well no Rights needed/programs. First of all, go to start > run > cmd - Type that in run then hit enter.
It's the command promt.
Now what u wanna do is type in "net user" in it. Itll show u the accs in the computer now.
now type in "net user (your name to bypass) *" And hit enter > E.g "net user owner *" No quotes
Now it shall ask you to enter a password: Enter one. Make sure u can rember it cuz it wont show. Now enter it again then hit enter. Now you are done!!! Type exit or click X and it is to the pass u want.
Disclaimer: I take no responsibillity to what happens to you. I got infromation off youtube gathering bits and pieces.
A vid Tutorial can be found [url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=oC8c7zKLnU4&mode=related&search=]Here[/url]

item.title: Great way how to bypass an admin account / change pass!
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

pk4pk:

Yea you can…You should have either Something looking like a batch file named command promt or then > start > run > cmd > net user etc. A batch file will come up

I didn’t say you couldn’t execute net users under limited account in XP.

I meant the function ‘user *’ does not work under a limited user account in XP.

Read full topic

Hi i will be teaching u how to bypass and admin account/rights!

Ok well no Rights needed/programs. First of all, go to start > run > cmd - Type that in run then hit enter.

It’s the command promt.

Now what u wanna do is type in “net user” in it. Itll show u the accs in the computer now.

Now it shall ask you to enter a password: Enter one. Make sure u can rember it cuz it wont show. Now enter it again then hit enter. Now you are done!!! Type exit or click X and it is to the pass u want.
